body_html: Hmm. To me it seems like it's a bug, especially because it doesn't lead to NaNs if exactly one NaN input is included after the valid inputs. But in any case if it's deemed too awkward to fix then it's not too big of a deal; since I encountered this I've been marking invalid time steps with 0s.

body: Hmm. To me it seems like it's a bug, especially because it doesn't lead to NaNs if exactly one NaN input is included after the valid inputs. But in any case if it's deemed too awkward to fix then it's not too big of a deal; since I encountered this I've been marking invalid time steps with 0s.
